docs.lead_paragraph: Spending has increased on political ads on the radio, which may be more effective at targeting a candidate’s intended audience, strategists said.

docs.abstract: Radio listeners in Iowa and New Hampshire are being inundated with political advertisements paid for by presidential candidates and their allies; political analysts say campaigns' emphasis on radio advertising is due to fact that it is relatively inexpensive, and may offer way to cut through white noise created by onslaught of television advertising many voters in states endure.
